title: 4 Easy Ways to Sign Out of WhatsApp

steps.title: Open WhatsApp on your mobile device.
steps.content: Open WhatsApp on your mobile device. It’s the green chat bubble icon on your home screen or in the app drawer (Android). Use this method to sign yourself out of the desktop or web version of WhatsApp when you’re not in front of the computer. You need to be using your primary phone for this to work. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap ⋮ (Android) or Settings (iPhone).
steps.content: Tap ⋮ (Android) or Settings (iPhone). The three-dot menu icon is in the top right corner and the cog icon is in the bottom right corner.

steps.title: Tap Linked Devices.
steps.content: Tap Linked Devices . This will be next to an icon of a laptop. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap your browser or device.
steps.content: Tap your browser or device. If you used Google Chrome on a Windows computer to access the web version of WhatsApp, you'll see Google Chrome (Windows) . Select the device you want to log out. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Log Out.
steps.content: Tap Log Out . This will be in red below the Activity field. [4] X Research source You'll need to tap Log Out again to confirm. You will be logged out of WhatsApp on your computer. Any active sessions will close.

steps.title: Open WhatsApp.
steps.content: Open WhatsApp. This looks like a white phone inside a green chat bubble.

steps.title: Back up your data.
steps.content: Back up your data. Because WhatsApp has no built-in Log Out button, you’ll have to sign out by deleting the app’s data from your device. To make sure you don’t lose your chats, you'll need to back them up to your Google Drive. To back up your data, tap ⋮ at the top-right of the screen. Tap Settings → Chats → Chat Backup → Backup . [5] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This looks like a cog icon located on your home screen or in the App Drawer. Alternatively, swipe down from the top of the screen to open the Quick Settings panel and tap the gear icon.

steps.title: Tap Apps.
steps.content: Tap Apps . You can find this underneath the Devices header.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap WhatsApp.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap WhatsApp . The apps are listed in alphabetical order, so you may have to scroll down quite a bit.

steps.title: Tap Storage.
steps.content: Tap Storage . If you don’t see a Storage option but see a button that says “Clear Data,” skip to the next step.

steps.title: Tap Clear Cache.
steps.content: Tap Clear Cache . This can usually be found next to Clear Data . Clearing the app's cache will delete the temporary data and content stored in your device.

steps.title: Tap Clear Data.
steps.content: Tap Clear Data . This will delete the WhatsApp app. If you see a confirmation message asking if you want to delete the app’s settings and files, tap OK . Otherwise, just skip to the next step.

steps.title: Open WhatsApp.
steps.content: Open WhatsApp. It will open to the sign-in screen, indicating that you’ve been logged out. When you want to sign back in, open WhatsApp and enter your username and password. You’ll be prompted to restore from the backup you made. If you linked devices so you can log in to use WhatsApp online, you can log out of those sessions. In that case, open WhatsApp and go to ⋮ > Linked Devices > Tap a device > Log out .

steps.title: Open WhatsApp.
steps.content: Open WhatsApp. This looks like a white phone inside a green chat bubble. Use this method to log out of WhatsApp on iOS.

steps.title: Back up your chats.
steps.content: Back up your chats. Because WhatsApp has no built-in Log Out button, you’ll have to uninstall the app to log out. To ensure you don’t lose messages, you'll need to back them up to iCloud first. [6] X Research source To back up your data, tap Settings at the bottom-right corner. Tap Chats → Chat Backup → Back Up Now .

steps.title: Exit WhatsApp.
steps.content: Exit WhatsApp. Depending on where the app is located, you'll need to return to your homepage or App Library.

steps.title: Tap and hold the WhatsApp icon.
steps.content: Tap and hold the WhatsApp icon. A menu will pop open after you hold the app icon down for a second or two. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Remove App.
steps.content: Tap Remove App . This will be in red and will prompt another menu to open. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Delete App.
steps.content: Tap Delete App . Then, tap Delete again to confirm. The app will be removed from your device. [9] X Research source If you cannot delete the app, it may be due to screen time restrictions on your iPhone.

steps.title: Download WhatsApp
steps.content: Download WhatsApp when you want to sign back in. You can do this by searching for “WhatsApp” in the App Store and tapping the cloud icon when it appears in your search results. Upon signing back in, you’ll be prompted to tap Restore to restore your chat data. This will retrieve all your past messages . If you linked devices so you can log in to use WhatsApp online, you can log out of those sessions. In that case, open WhatsApp and go to Settings > Linked Devices > Tap a device > Log out .

steps.title: Open WhatsApp on your computer.
steps.content: Open WhatsApp on your computer. You can use this for the desktop client or the web version of WhatsApp. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Click .
steps.content: Click . You'll see this gear icon next to your profile icon. If you're using the desktop client, click your profile icon instead.

steps.title: Select Log out.
steps.content: Select Log out . It's in red text at the bottom of the Settings menu.
